title: UP SIR: Nearly 3 crore names deleted from draft rolls; claims open till Feb 6, final list on Mar 6
description: Uttar Pradesh's draft voter rolls reveal nearly 3 crore deletions, with 18.7% of electors removed. Citizens have until February 6 to file claims and objections to reinstate their names before final rolls are published on March 6.

Office productivity just performance? ‘I sit for 8 hrs & pretend to work,’ shares employee
description: A Reddit post by a young intern highlights a growing workplace trend called “task masking,” appearing busy without doing meaningful work. From interns to senior leaders, many admit to performing productivity rather than producing results. In reality, task masking is a management and culture problem, driven by visibility-based evaluation, unclear goals, and fear of being seen as idle.

title: Chip timeline call: Musk predicts delays for Nvidia’s Rubin; Says won’t be operational for months
description: Elon Musk acknowledged Nvidia's new Vera Rubin chips, praising their design but predicting nine months for scaled operational use and smooth software function. He also expressed skepticism about Nvidia's self-driving technology, calling its distribution "super hard" to solve, though wishing them success.

title: Apple execs won't leave South Korea: Hunting Samsung, SK Hynix supply; iPhone RAM at risk
description: Tech giants, including Apple, are reportedly camping out in South Korean hotels to secure crucial memory chip supplies.  A global shortage, driven by AI demand, has sent RAM prices soaring, forcing companies to negotiate long-term contracts.  This situation could lead to higher iPhone prices or reduced memory in future models.

title: From $13mn to $8.4b: San Francisco 49ers owner York family net worth
description: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.
